title: Can we convert AV_PIX_FMT_BGR24 () to SKBitmap
body:
SIPSorceryMedia.Abstractions.RawImage contains all necessary info about an image in AV_PIX_FMT_BGR24 format (format in FFmpeg context)
So 8 bits for B, 8 bits for G, 8 bits for R (=> 24 bits for one pixel), it's size (width and height) and it's stride
According the library, we must use an equivalent:
    use 8 bits for each colors
    no alpha
    necessary to specify width, height and stride

Based on above info, how could I convert AV_PIX_FMT_BGR24 format (format in FFmpeg context) to SKBitmap

comments.author: mail2mhossain
